replies.body:
Electing to run League on an unsupported Operating System also means you elect to accept the risks that go along with it. Crashes and incompatibilities are far more common on Linux than they are on Windows or Mac OS. I'm a huge fan of Linux, so I understand not wanting to give up League because of your OS, but disconnecting from a match still negatively impacts everyone else in it, regardless of intent. This is a key reason why the system treats all disconnections equally and why penalties cannot be modified.

Although I cannot provide support for Linux, I can confirm that most of the crashes that occur during champ select are often caused by brief disconnections from the server. Our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) is a comprehensive list of steps we ask players take to resolve these types of issues and many of them can still apply to your OS.

Let me know if you have any questions.
